title: Place a line equal to a given line at a given point

steps.instruction: Join point A to point B

steps.notes: I.1 macro produces apex D plus segments DA and DB. No circles are added to state — they are internal to the proven tool.

steps.instruction: Draw a circle centered at B through C
Mark where the circle crosses line DB, past B
steps.notes: E is on the extension of DB beyond B. seg-4 is the segment from D to B created by the I.1 macro.

steps.instruction: Draw a circle centered at D through E
Mark where the circle crosses line DA, past A
steps.notes: F is on the extension of DA beyond A. seg-3 is the segment from D to A created by the I.1 macro. Then C.N.3 gives AF = BE (subtracting DA from DF and DB from DE), and C.N.1 gives AF = BC transitively.

authorNotes: The key insight is using the equilateral triangle to create two radii from D that share a common length (DA = DB), enabling the subtraction argument via C.N.3. The tutorial should emphasize picking the intersection 'past B' and 'past A' — the beyondId constraint is critical.
